list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Add TensorFlow MBSTS Notebook
A Jupyter notebook `mbsts_tensorflow.ipynb` is added under the `src/notebooks` directory. It includes a detailed step-by-step implementation of a Multivariate Bayesian structural time series (MBSTS) model using TensorFlow and TensorFlow Probability. The notebook further shows how to fit the model with Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) sampling and visualize posterior estimates.

project.component: { "keyToString": { "BibTeX.main bibliography.executor": "Run", "BibTeX.main/bib_nova.executor": "Run", "BibTeX.main_bibtex.executor": "Run", "LaTeX.main.executor": "Run", "LaTeX.main/nova.executor": "Run", "Makeindex.main makeglossaries.executor": "Run", "Makeindex.main makeindex.executor": "Run", "RunOnceActivity.OpenProjectViewOnStart": "true", "RunOnceActivity.ShowReadmeOnStart": "true", "SHARE_PROJECT_CONFIGURATION_FILES": "true", "dart.analysis.tool.window.visible": "false", "git-widget-placeholder": "seminar", "ignore.virus.scanning.warn.message": "true", "last_opened_file_path": "C:/Users/E353682/OneDrive - FCT NOVA/Repos/novathesis_template/src/notebooks", "node.js.detected.package.eslint": "true", "node.js.detected.package.tslint": "true", "node.js.selected.package.eslint": "(autodetect)", "node.js.selected.package.tslint": "(autodetect)", "nodejs_package_manager_path": "npm", "run.code.analysis.last.selected.profile": "pProject Default", "settings.editor.selected.configurable": "org.jetbrains.r.configuration.RSettingsProjectConfigurable", "vue.rearranger.settings.migration": "true" }, "keyToStringList": { "DatabaseDriversLRU": [ "oracle", "synapse", "sqlserver", "azure" ], "com.intellij.ide.scratch.LRUPopupBuilder$1/SQL Dialect": [ "OracleSqlPlus" ] } }

task.summary: Default task

Add bibliography entries for wind energy articles
Two articles regarding wind energy, "Dynamic pricing of wind futures" and "Handling the risk dimensions of wind energy generation", have been added to the bibliography. These entries include the articles' details, such as title, author, journal, and year of publication, facilitating their citation in future academic work.

Add new chapter for wind power generation
A new chapter titled 'Wind Power Generation' has been added to the thesis document. The chapter discusses various aspects of wind energy, including wind speed, wind power, capacity factor, and provides mathematical equations related to these aspects. It also includes sections on wind energy production and related revenue calculations.

Add new bibliography entry in main.bib
A new techreport entry has been added into the main.bib file. The entry corresponds to a document titled "Europe levelized cost of electricity (LCOE) 2023" authored by Ahmed Abdullah and published by Wood Mackenzie, providing an outlook of power technology and generation cost trends in Europe for 2023.

Update project configuration files
New IDE project configuration files have been added, and existing ones updated. Changes include specifying Python 3.12 as the project SDK, defining Git as the VCS and adding a module mapping for the CAT project.

Add new symbols to symbols.tex
New symbols have been added to the symbols.tex file. The capacity factor symbol (cf_t) being notable among these. These additions serve to enhance comprehension and referencing in our mathematical discussions within the project.

Add chapters on hedging volume risk and power price modelling
Two new chapters on hedging volume risk and power price modelling have been added to the thesis. These chapters discuss crucial components of the thesis and provide detailed explanations about each subject.

Correct filename identifier in Chapter 3
File identifier in Chapter 3 has been corrected from 'my-chapter2.tex' to 'my-chapter3.tex'. This change ensures proper file referencing. Also, the unused `\glsresetall` command was removed to streamline the code.

Add Wind Futures section and remove unnecessary command in chapter 2
Added a comprehensive section about Wind Futures in 'my-chapter2.tex', increasing the details on futures in the energy market. Also, improved the code's efficiency by removing the redundant '\glsresetall' command, enhancing code readability.

Update citation formatting and introduce renewable generation costs section
Refactored citation formatting for consistency and improved comprehension in 'my-chapter1.tex'. Also, introduced a content-rich section discussing renewable generation costs, expanding on the analysis of the Levelized Cost of Energy (LCOE) for various power generation technologies. Changes aim to enhance the chapter's thoroughness and readability.

Rename template.tex to main.tex
The file formerly known as 'template.tex' has been renamed to 'main.tex' for clarity. Additionally, a line was updated in the file to reflect this change and maintain correct citations in the LaTeX document.

Add new acronyms to the acronyms.tex
Several new acronyms have been incorporated into acronyms.tex file to enhance understanding of terms in the main text. This update aims to make the document more accessible and comprehensive.

Add new chapters to 4_files.tex
Three new chapter files have been added to the 4_files.tex and one existing chapter was commented out. This addition includes chapters on wind modelling, power price modelling, and hedging strategies.

Update .gitignore exceptions
The .gitignore file has been updated to no longer include template.tex in the ignore list, and instead, considers main.tex as an exception. This change supports the recent structuring of our LaTeX project files.

Add new acronyms to acronyms.tex
The acronyms.tex file has been updated to include the abbreviations for European Energy Exchange (EEX) and European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF). This ensures we maintain a comprehensive list of abbreviations in our project.

Add new sections to my-chapter2.tex
Extended my-chapter2.tex by adding two new sections: "Renewable Generation Costs" and "Wind Futures". The first analyzes the levelized cost of electricity for power generation technologies in Europe, emphasizing onshore wind and utility-scale solar. The second section discusses the emerging market of wind futures and introduces related indexes.

Correct commit message: Fix citation and spacing in my-chapter1.tex
Updated citation format throughout my-chapter1.tex to ensure cohesive format. Also, added missing spaces for words that were joined together and refined a concluding sentence for clarity.

Fix incorrect filename in typeout command
The typeout command previously was referencing the incorrect filename my-chapter2.tex, hence it was updated to the correct filename my-chapter3.tex. The fix ensures that the actual filename being worked on corresponds with the filename stated in the typeout command.

Update Python version in novathesis_template
Changed the order entry in novathesis_template from inheritedJDK to Python 3.12 SDK. This ensures that the project will use the correct and uniform Python SDK across all involved modules and files.

Add new research articles to bibliography file
Updated the 'zotero.bib' bibliography file with two new research articles. The added articles focus on dynamic pricing of wind futures and strategies for managing the risk associated with wind energy production.

Update submission and exam dates in cover file
The submission and exam dates in the cover file '3_cover.tex' have been updated. The previous dates were set to 2023-12-13 and are now updated to 2024-02-28.

The provided commit message does not correspond to the changes shown in the diff. The diff shows changes in `4_files.tex` and not in `3_cover.tex`. Besides, it includes changes to chapters included, not dates. Based on the given diff, a correct commit message could be:
Modify included chapters in '4_files.tex'
The file references for included chapters in '4_files.tex' have been updated. 'my-chapter3' has been commented out, while 'my-chapter_wind_modelling' has been added. Three additional chapters have been listed but commented out for later inclusion if necessary.

Add new acronyms to 'acronyms.tex'
Two new acronyms have been added to the `acronyms.tex` file. The added acronyms are "Multivariate Bayesian Structural Time Series (MBSTS)" and "Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC)".

Uncomment Renewable Generation section and add Hedging section
The 'Renewable Generation Costs' section has been uncommented for inclusion in the final text. Additionally, a new 'Hedging RES Generation' section has been created, including a figure showing hedged discounted cash flow models. Some minor text edits have also been made to enhance clarity.

Revise and remove sections in Chapter 2
The "Renewable Generation Costs" section in Chapter 2 was removed. Meanwhile, the text in the 'Wind Futures' section was revised to improve clarity and understanding. Now, a new citation gives additional credibility and support to the presented information.

Add new chapters to the thesis
Two new chapters, "Power Price Modelling" and "Hedging Volume Risk", have been added to the thesis. Both chapters contain basic structure with predefined packages and a starting statement about their essential role in the thesis.

Add new chapters on Wind Power Generation and Capacity Factor
Introduced a detailed chapter on "Wind Power Generation" detailing the methodology to model wind power based on historical and forecast data. Also added a chapter on 'Capacity Factor' with an in depth explanation of the metric's significance in assessing a power production asset's performance and financial implications. This forms the foundational work for future expansions or modifications.

Add new references to bibliography
Updated the bibliography file (`zotero.bib`) with new references covering various topics such as Bayesian Structural Time Series, state space time series analysis, and multivariate Bayesian models. These references will support new insights into time series forecasting and present advanced statistical methods for the future studies.

Add PPA acronym to the acronyms section
An acronym for power purchase agreement (PPA) was added to the acronyms section in the acronyms.tex file. This ensures that the term is properly defined and can be used consistently throughout the document.

Add detailed description in chapter 1 about hedging RES generation
This commit adds a comprehensive description about the hedging of renewable energy source (RES) generation in the first chapter of the thesis. Major topics covered include renewables' impact on power markets, potential hedging strategies and their evaluation, and the use of various derivatives as hedges.

Add bm package to LaTeX configuration
This commit adds the "bm" package to the LaTeX configuration file. This package is used for rendering bold symbols, enhancing the flexibility of mathematical and scientific expression in the text.

Updated thesis chapter on wind modelling
In this commit, text revisions for clarity and grammar were implemented and a new subsection regarding state components was introduced into the wind modelling chapter of the thesis. This new content primarily comprises a detailed discussion on the trend component of a structural time series model, including its definition and mathematical formulation.

Add seasonal component subsection in my-chapter_wind_modelling
The update includes a new subsection named 'Seasonality' in 'my-chapter_wind_modelling'. The content elaborates on how the seasonal component plays a critical part in structural time series model with appropriate examples and equations. The unnecessary line in '5_packages.tex' was also removed.

Add new project configurations and update IDE settings
Added several new project configuration files and updated existing ones in the .idea directory. Changes include Python SDK specification to 3.12, Git integration, new run configurations for different LaTeX tasks, and various settings related to the project's IDE environment.

Add new project configurations and update IDE settings
Additional project configuration files have been added and existing ones have been updated in the .idea directory. Changes include a changed Python SDK specification, Git integration, new run configurations for LaTeX tasks, and various project IDE environment settings.

Add seminar abstract for June 2024
A new LaTeX document has been created to represent the seminar abstract scheduled for June 2024. The document contains the preliminary setup, the main abstract text discussing a Monte Carlo Simulation Study using Bayesian time series for energy hedging strategies, relevant keywords, and a short biography of the author.

Commented out the "mathastext" package in the LaTeX configuration
In the document configuration file, the line adding the "mathastext" package for upright Greek letters was commented out. This change does not remove the package but disables its usage within the document.

Updated workspace settings and run configurations
Significant updates have been made to the workspace.xml and runConfigurations/main_nova.xml files. These include changing some IDE settings, the selection of a different compiler, and specifying a path for SumatraPDF.

Add new reference to Zotero bibliography
This commit includes a new entry added to the Zotero bibliography file zotero.bib. The addition is an article titled "Seasonality in High Frequency Time Series" authored by Proietti, Tommaso and Pedregal, Diego J., published in 2023.

Expand and enhance section on seasonal component modelling
In the documentation, the section about seasonal component modelling in time series has been significantly expanded and enhanced. It now includes more detailed explanations, mathematical models, and examples. The update also improves the handling of multivariate time series and elaborates on the role of the white noise error term.

Refactor wind modelling chapter and add cyclical component
The wind modelling chapter was thoroughly refactored for improved clarity and readability. Notably, the linear trend component explanation was expanded with better mathematical representation. A new section discussing the cyclical component was included, offering a detailed insight into how medium-to-long term oscillations are modeled in the data series. Lastly, minor spelling corrections were made and redundant pieces of information were removed or consolidated.

Add wind prediction functionality in mur_wind_prev notebooks
This commit creates new Python and Jupyter notebook files in the src/notebooks directory. The main function get_wind_prev_pivot, which takes historical wind data and performs a pivot operation to calculate the mean wind speed, has been implemented in the mur_wind_prev.py file. An additional helper function get_facilities_props is included which retrieves properties of various wind zones. The notebooks mur_wind_prev.ipynb and raw_tdmi_lov_edpr_facilities.ipynb illustrate use-cases with each function in an interactive manner.

Update dependencies and refactor wind modelling chapter
Updated project dependencies to use Python 3.12 SDK named hedging_renewables. Refactored the wind modelling chapter for improved clarity and added a new section that discusses the cyclical component. The refactoring process included the expansion of the linear trend component explanation, making minor spelling corrections, and removing or consolidating redundant information. The project's .idea configuration files were also updated accordingly.

Update and expand wind modelling equations in documentation
The wind modelling chapter's mathematical description was significantly updated and expanded. Equations related to the trend, seasonality, and cyclical disturbance components were modified for clarity and consistency. A new subsection was added detailing the regression component of the time series model, which explains the influence of known external factors on the time series.

Add TensorFlow MBSTS Notebook
A Jupyter notebook `mbsts_tensorflow.ipynb` is added under the `src/notebooks` directory. It includes a detailed step-by-step implementation of a Multivariate Bayesian structural time series (MBSTS) model using TensorFlow and TensorFlow Probability. The notebook further shows how to fit the model with Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) sampling and visualize posterior estimates.

Add new chapters to the thesis
Two new chapters, "Power Price Modelling" and "Hedging Volume Risk", have been added to the thesis. Both chapters contain basic structure with predefined packages and a starting statement about their essential role in the thesis.

Add new chapters to the thesis
Two new chapters on "Power Price Modelling" and "Hedging Volume Risk" have been introduced to the thesis. Currently, they include preliminary structure with essential LaTeX packages and a brief introductory statement outlining their significance in the context of the thesis.

Add new chapters on Wind Power Generation and Capacity Factor
Introduced a detailed chapter on "Wind Power Generation" detailing the methodology to model wind power based on historical and forecast data. Also added a chapter on 'Capacity Factor' with an in depth explanation of the metric's significance in assessing a power production asset's performance and financial implications. This forms the foundational work for future expansions or modifications.

Add new references to bibliography
Updated the bibliography file (`zotero.bib`) with new references covering various topics such as Bayesian Structural Time Series, state space time series analysis, and multivariate Bayesian models. These references will support new insights into time series forecasting and present advanced statistical methods for the future studies.

Add PPA acronym to the acronyms section
An acronym for power purchase agreement (PPA) was added to the acronyms section in the acronyms.tex file. This ensures that the term is properly defined and can be used consistently throughout the document.

Add detailed description in chapter 1 about hedging RES generation
This commit adds a comprehensive description about the hedging of renewable energy source (RES) generation in the first chapter of the thesis. Major topics covered include renewables' impact on power markets, potential hedging strategies and their evaluation, and the use of various derivatives as hedges.

Add bm package to LaTeX configuration
This commit adds the "bm" package to the LaTeX configuration file. This package is used for rendering bold symbols, enhancing the flexibility of mathematical and scientific expression in the text.

Updated thesis chapter on wind modelling
In this commit, text revisions for clarity and grammar were implemented and a new subsection regarding state components was introduced into the wind modelling chapter of the thesis. This new content primarily comprises a detailed discussion on the trend component of a structural time series model, including its definition and mathematical formulation.

Add seasonal component subsection in my-chapter_wind_modelling
The update includes a new subsection named 'Seasonality' in 'my-chapter_wind_modelling'. The content elaborates on how the seasonal component plays a critical part in structural time series model with appropriate examples and equations. The unnecessary line in '5_packages.tex' was also removed.

Add new project configurations and update IDE settings
Added several new project configuration files and updated existing ones in the .idea directory. Changes include Python SDK specification to 3.12, Git integration, new run configurations for different LaTeX tasks, and various settings related to the project's IDE environment.

Add new project configurations and update IDE settings
Additional project configuration files have been added and existing ones have been updated in the .idea directory. Changes include a changed Python SDK specification, Git integration, new run configurations for LaTeX tasks, and various project IDE environment settings.

Comment out seasonal component descriptions in wind modelling chapter
The seasonal component descriptions in the wind modelling chapter of the text have been commented out. This change was made in the 'my-chapter_wind_modelling.tex' file. Future improvements or alterations can be made easily as the information is preserved, just not visible in the presented text.

Add seminar abstract and improve seasonal component description
A new seminar abstract has been added and the description of the seasonal component in the wind modelling chapter has been refined with a more detailed explanation. The run configurations and packages in the project settings have also been updated.

Add seminar abstract for June 2024
A new LaTeX document has been created to represent the seminar abstract scheduled for June 2024. The document contains the preliminary setup, the main abstract text discussing a Monte Carlo Simulation Study using Bayesian time series for energy hedging strategies, relevant keywords, and a short biography of the author.

Commented out the "mathastext" package in the LaTeX configuration
In the document configuration file, the line adding the "mathastext" package for upright Greek letters was commented out. This change does not remove the package but disables its usage within the document.

Updated workspace settings and run configurations
Significant updates have been made to the workspace.xml and runConfigurations/main_nova.xml files. These include changing some IDE settings, the selection of a different compiler, and specifying a path for SumatraPDF.

Add new reference to Zotero bibliography
This commit includes a new entry added to the Zotero bibliography file zotero.bib. The addition is an article titled "Seasonality in High Frequency Time Series" authored by Proietti, Tommaso and Pedregal, Diego J., published in 2023.

Expand and enhance section on seasonal component modelling
In the documentation, the section about seasonal component modelling in time series has been significantly expanded and enhanced. It now includes more detailed explanations, mathematical models, and examples. The update also improves the handling of multivariate time series and elaborates on the role of the white noise error term.

Include main.pdf in version control
The .gitignore file has been updated to stop ignoring the main.pdf file. This file is now included in the version control, allowing it to be shared and versioned along with the rest of the project.

Refactor wind modelling chapter and add cyclical component
The wind modelling chapter was thoroughly refactored for improved clarity and readability. Notably, the linear trend component explanation was expanded with better mathematical representation. A new section discussing the cyclical component was included, offering a detailed insight into how medium-to-long term oscillations are modeled in the data series. Lastly, minor spelling corrections were made and redundant pieces of information were removed or consolidated.

Add wind prediction functionality in mur_wind_prev notebooks
This commit creates new Python and Jupyter notebook files in the src/notebooks directory. The main function get_wind_prev_pivot, which takes historical wind data and performs a pivot operation to calculate the mean wind speed, has been implemented in the mur_wind_prev.py file. An additional helper function get_facilities_props is included which retrieves properties of various wind zones. The notebooks mur_wind_prev.ipynb and raw_tdmi_lov_edpr_facilities.ipynb illustrate use-cases with each function in an interactive manner.

Update dependencies and refactor wind modelling chapter
Updated project dependencies to use Python 3.12 SDK named hedging_renewables. Refactored the wind modelling chapter for improved clarity and added a new section that discusses the cyclical component. The refactoring process included the expansion of the linear trend component explanation, making minor spelling corrections, and removing or consolidating redundant information. The project's .idea configuration files were also updated accordingly.

Update mathematical formulae and explanations in wind modeling chapter
This commit revises various mathematical expressions and related explanations throughout the "Wind Modelling" chapter to clarify and improve their coherence. The adjustments include changes in trend, seasonality and cyclical components, as well as introducing a new regression component. This will ensure the readability and comprehension of the equations used in the modeling process.

Update and expand wind modelling equations in documentation
The wind modelling chapter's mathematical description was significantly updated and expanded. Equations related to the trend, seasonality, and cyclical disturbance components were modified for clarity and consistency. A new subsection was added detailing the regression component of the time series model, which explains the influence of known external factors on the time series.

Add TensorFlow MBSTS Notebook
A Jupyter notebook `mbsts_tensorflow.ipynb` is added under the `src/notebooks` directory. It includes a detailed step-by-step implementation of a Multivariate Bayesian structural time series (MBSTS) model using TensorFlow and TensorFlow Probability. The notebook further shows how to fit the model with Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) sampling and visualize posterior estimates.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
Add TensorFlow MBSTS Notebook
A Jupyter notebook `mbsts_tensorflow.ipynb` is added under the `src/notebooks` directory. It includes a detailed step-by-step implementation of a Multivariate Bayesian structural time series (MBSTS) model using TensorFlow and TensorFlow Probability. The notebook further shows how to fit the model with Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) sampling and visualize posterior estimates.
